translation: Having done so, Mahāprajāpatī replied to the king: It is not that I am unable to fight with you. Since you are my wife and father, it is only a secret relative.

source_sentence: 當善思量身存為本。
translation: You should well contemplate that the body exists as the root.

source_sentence: 今至我所活不自由，若不信言當須親驗。
translation: Now that I'm here, I won't be free to live, and if I don't believe what I say, I'll need to personally testify.

source_sentence: 我將某物與某大臣，其五百人皆受贈賜，可即搜問足了真虛。』
translation: I'll give something to a certain minister, and all five hundred of them will be given as gifts, so you can search out the true and false by asking questions.'

source_sentence: 彼即尋求悉皆是實，彼知事異中夜收軍，既至城已遂便總殺五百大臣，
translation: He immediately sought out all of them to be true facts. In the middle of the night he secretly gathered his troops and, having arrived in the city, killed all five hundred ministers.

source_sentence: 諸臣之子令繼父業。
translation: The sons of the ministers were ordered to continue their father's business.

source_sentence: 大藥白王：『事已如是，且無他難，我欲暫往求女為婚，得不未知須觀其意。』
translation: Mahāprajāpaṇa said to the king, 'So it is, and there's no difficulty for anyone else; I want to go temporarily to ask a woman to marry me, but I don't know what she thinks.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『隨去。』
translation: The king said, 'Follow me.'

source_sentence: 大藥將兵往半遮羅國園中停止，彼王便喚可入城來。
translation: The general of Mahāprajāpaṇa went to the park in the country of Pāṇḍara and stopped there, and the king summoned him to enter the city.

source_sentence: 答曰：『我不入城，且宜向彼大臣家住。』
translation: He replied, 'I won't enter the city; it's better to go and stay at that minister's house.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『隨意。』
translation: The king said, 'As you wish.'

source_sentence: 時諸臣子共作是議：『殺我等父皆由大藥，既是怨讎不應輒放。』
translation: The ministers then made this argument together, saying, 'It's because of the great medicine that we killed our fathers, and since it's a grudge, we shouldn't let him go.'

source_sentence: 臣白王曰：『鞞提醯王自無計策，興隆王業皆是大藥之功，由此不能有所侵掠，
translation: The ministers said to the king, “Your majesty, King Candracchattra has no power of calculation. It is only due to the efficacy of this great medicine that you cannot attack or plunder me.” The king’s ministers replied:

source_sentence: 且留於此勿令四出，我將兵眾往破彼城。』
translation: Let's stay here and don't let the four escape; I'll go with my troops to break through that city.'

source_sentence: 王乃稱善，即領四兵至鞞提醯國圍遶其城。
translation: The king then praised him as good and led his four armies to the country of Kaṇṭikā and surrounded it.

source_sentence: 于時大藥知半遮王從某道去向鞞提醯，大藥訪知彼王珍寶咸在某處，并女妙藥一處同居。
translation: At the time, Mahāprajāpaṇa knew that the king of Pāṇḍikā had departed from a certain path and headed for Kārttika, and Mahāprajāpaṇa visited him to know that the king's treasures were all in a certain place, and they lived together in one place with the woman's marvelous medicine.

source_sentence: 大藥即便強入宮中，將女妙藥及諸珍寶，總率兵眾別路而歸。
translation: The great medicine then forcibly entered the palace, took the woman's marvelous medicine and other treasures, led their troops together, and returned by a different path.

source_sentence: 既見王已，總集朝官慶喜無量。
translation: Having seen the king, they gathered together the officials of the court to celebrate immeasurable joy.

source_sentence: 時半遮國使至奏王：『珍寶及女被他將去。』
translation: Halfway there, the king's envoy arrived to report to the king, saying, 'The treasure and the woman are about to leave by someone else.'

source_sentence: 王得信已爰命旋師。
translation: After the king had gained faith, he ordered the master to turn around.

source_sentence: 時此國王廣施大禮，婚媾已畢，即策妙藥為大夫人。
translation: The king of that country then offered a large bow and, after the marriage ceremony was over, he named Miaojia as his great wife.

source_sentence: 時半遮王令使齎書與妙藥曰：『我懷憂悶汝豈不知，可細尋求誰傳此事，
translation: At midday the king of Kapilavastu summoned the messenger and gave him this wonderful medicine, saying: I am overcome with sorrow. Don’t you know who to tell me about this matter?

source_sentence: 食和毒藥欲害彼王？』
translation: Do you want to harm the king by eating and mixing poisonous medicine?'

source_sentence: 女得書已推察其事，知是大藥鸚鵡傳通密信，令使報父。
translation: After receiving the letter, the woman investigated the matter and knew that it was a great hermaphrodite who had secretly sent a letter to tell her father.

source_sentence: 父得書已，覆遣使報通此消息：『皆由鸚鵡察知事已往還相報，遂致紛披喪亂家國，
translation: Having received the letter, his father sent an envoy to report this message: It was all due to the fact that after the parrot had inspected the governor’s office, they returned and reported back to each other. As a consequence, many of them lost their homes and countries in disorder.

source_sentence: 彼之鸚鵡可附將來。』
translation: That parrot will be attached in the future.'

source_sentence: 女籠鸚鵡寄與父王，王見鸚鵡倍生瞋恚：『由此儜鳥亡國喪親，更勿評論即宜殺却。』
translation: When the woman's caged parrot sent it to her father, the king saw the parrot and became even more angry when he saw it, saying, 'Because this bird lost its country and lost its relatives, don't comment on it; it's better to kill it.'

source_sentence: 鳥乃稽首而白王曰：『幸願依我祖父死法以取命終，死亦無恨。』
translation: The bird then bowed its head and said to the king, 'May I rely on my grandfather's death as a way to end my life so that there won't be any grudge when I die.'

source_sentence: 王曰：『隨彼死法而斷其命。』
translation: The king said, 'Follow the law of that death and cut off his life.'

source_sentence: 屠者問曰：『死法如何？』
translation: The butcher asked, 'What's the method of dying?'

source_sentence: 鸚鵡答曰：『麻纏我尾灌以膏油，爇火令著任其自死。』
translation: The parrot answered, 'The hemp wrapped my tail around it and poured it into grease and oil, and the fire burned it so that it would be caught and left to die on its own.'

source_sentence: 屠者如言作已而放，鸚鵡遂即飛上虛空，奮迅毛羽火延空室燒盡無遺，
translation: The butcher did as he said and released it, and the parrot flew up into the air. His hair stood on end in flames and his room burned out without residue.

source_sentence: 遂入池中洗沐而去，騰雲振翼往鞞提醯。
translation: He then entered the pond, washed and bathed, and departed, rising clouds and waving his wings to go to Kārttika.

source_sentence: 大藥問曰：『汝生還耶？』
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā asked, 'Are you born back?'

source_sentence: 鸚鵡具答，大藥歡喜。
translation: The parrot answered in full, and Mahāprajāpaṇḍika rejoiced.

source_sentence: 「半遮羅王瞋心猛熾，更與女書：『由此鸚鵡，燒我宮室。
translation: King Bimbisāra became angry and wrote to the queen, saying, 'This parrot will burn my palace.

source_sentence: 必須牢縛急送將來。』
translation: They must be bound and quickly delivered in the future.'

source_sentence: 女即如言還送鸚鵡。
translation: The woman then returned to send the parrot back as she said.

source_sentence: 王見大怒令燖毛羽煮以沸湯。
translation: Seeing this, the king became very angry and ordered his hair stood on end and feathers boiled in boiling water.

source_sentence: 屠者去毛棄之簷外，報言：『汝去。』
translation: The butcher removes his hair and discards it outside the eaves, and he replies, 'Go away.'

source_sentence: 飛鵄下見，撮以[夌*欠]虛到一神祠。
translation: He flew down to see it and took it up in the air and carried it to a deva temple.

source_sentence: 鵄便欲食，遂告鵄曰：『兄食我身肉纔一日，如其見放，於日日中上好肉食常令飽滿。』
translation: He then wanted to eat, so he told him, 'My brother ate my flesh for only one day, and if he releases it as he sees it, he'll always be satisfied with the best meat food every day.'

source_sentence: 鵄曰：『誰當信汝？』
translation: He said, 'Who will believe you?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『為作盟要，又復我無翅羽不可飛空，一兩日間目觀虛實。』
translation: He answered, 'For the sake of making an alliance, I have no wings or feathers to fly up in the sky, and for a day or two my eyes are observing the truth.'

source_sentence: 復告鵄曰：『雖是恩慈未得其處，持我至彼王天祠邊徐放于地。』
translation: Again, he told Śāriputra, 'Even though this is a place of kindness and compassion that hasn't yet been found, take me to the side of that king's deva temple and slowly release me on the ground.'

source_sentence: 鵄隨言作至神祠處，進其堂內入神背後一小穴中，其守天祠人以諸香花神前供養。
translation: He went to the place where the shrine was located and entered a small cave behind the deity inside the hall. The guardians of the deity’s shrine offered incense and flowers as offerings to the deity before him.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡言曰：『汝去報王，王有惡行諸神共瞋，比遭衰禍皆是我作，若不供養殃酷未休，
translation: The parrot said, 'Go and report to the king. If he commits any evil deeds, the gods will become angry with him. It's better for me to do it than if I were to experience misfortune.

source_sentence: 可於日日多獻生肉，胡麻豆子各置一升，如是存誠我為思審。』
translation: You should offer plenty of cooked meat every day, and place one sheng each of sesame beans and beans in it; thus I will deliberate with sincerity.'

source_sentence: 時守護人便將此語白大王知，王曰：『若如是者，隨所言教，我當悉為作是祭神。』
translation: The guardian then reported these words to the king, who said, 'If that's the case, follow what he teaches, and I will make this offering for them all.'

source_sentence: 經多時節鵄食生肉，鸚鵡飡麻毛羽漸成，堪得飛颺欲有去意，告守護人曰：『汝可報王，
translation: At the end of many seasons they eat raw meat and parrots, which gradually grow into hair, flesh, feathers, hair, and feathers. They will be able to fly away if you wish.

source_sentence: 爾所多時供養於我，更有一事汝不得違。
translation: You've often offered support to me, and there's another thing you mustn't disobey.

source_sentence: 王及中宮城隍寮庶，咸剃鬚髮俱來我所，我當施與富樂無窮。』
translation: The king and the gods of the middle palace, cities, temples, and common people all shaved their hair and came to me, and I will give them wealth and happiness without limit.'

source_sentence: 使者白王，王即隨作，盡除鬚髮至天祠中，禮天神足求哀懺謝。
translation: The messenger said to the king, who did as he wished and removed all his hair and beard and went to a deva temple to pay homage to the gods' feet and beg for their repentance.

source_sentence: 「『凡事皆反報，　　無有不報者；
translation: 'All things are reciprocally rewarded, and there is nothing that isn't rewarded.

source_sentence: 汝落我身毛，　　我今還剃汝。』
translation: You've dropped my hair, and now I'll shave you back.'

source_sentence: 鸚鵡飛出，空中說頌曰：「作是語已搏霄而去。
translation: The parrot flew out and spoke a verse in the air, saying, After saying these words, he rose up into the sky and departed.

source_sentence: 至大藥所，問曰：『何意遲遲令我見怪？』
translation: He went to the great medicine and asked, 'What do you think it's so late that I'll be surprised?'

source_sentence: 即便具說比所經事，大藥聞已極生歡悅具白王知，王嗟希有，報言：『大藥！
translation: He then explained the matter of the sūtras in detail, and after hearing them, Da Bhaiṣajyarāja was overjoyed and reported them to the king. The king admired their rareness and reported, 'Da Bhaiṣajyarāja!

source_sentence: 汝真有福，所感眷屬皆悉聰明。
translation: You truly have merit, and all the members of your retinue you've inspired are all intelligent.

source_sentence: 毘舍佉神智過人，鸚鵡鳥世所難及。』
translation: Vaiśravaṇa's supernormal wisdom surpasses that of humans, which is unmatched by a parrot or bird in the world.'

source_sentence: 「後於異時王作是念：『於諸臣中誰最有智？』
translation: At another time, the king thought, 'Who among the ministers is the most wise?'

source_sentence: 於諸大臣人付一狗令其養飼，齊爾許時教作人語。
translation: The ministers gave a dog to be raised, and they all told him to speak humanely at the right time.

source_sentence: 諸臣將狗各還其舍，倍加養飼，然無方法能令人語。
translation: The ministers returned each of the dogs to their dwelling and gave them twice as much nourishment, but there was no way to tell them.

source_sentence: 大藥得狗亦將至家，去常食床不遠而繫。
translation: The dog who had obtained the great medicine was also about to go home, tied up at a place not far from the usual food-eating bed.

source_sentence: 其狗每見大藥食時芳香芬烈餅果盈前，雖有希望不與一片。
translation: Whenever the dog sees a great treat, it's filled with fragrant, fragrant cakes and fruits, and even though it has hope, it won't give them a single piece.

source_sentence: 但將麁食而養餧之，支濟性命不令其死，形容消瘦僅得存軀。
translation: He simply feeds and nourishes them with food, relieving their vitality so that they won't die, and his appearance disappears and he can only keep his body alive.

source_sentence: 王總命臣所養之狗可將來集，試復觀察解人語未？
translation: The king ordered his ministers to gather the dogs that he had raised. Would you like to see if they could understand human speech?

source_sentence: 諸狗既至，悉皆肥悅並不解語，唯大藥狗羸瘠異常，王曰：『卿狗何瘦？』
translation: When the dogs arrived, they were all fat and happy but didn't understand words, except for the great medicinal dog that was so weak and abnormally hungry that the king said, 'Why is your dog so thin?'

source_sentence: 答言：『大王！
translation: He replied, 'Great king!

source_sentence: 我所食者常與同味。』
translation: Whatever I eat always shares the same taste with them.'

source_sentence: 狗便語曰：『此人妄語，我常受飢幾將至死。』
translation: The dog then said, 'This man speaks falsely, saying, 'I'll always suffer hunger for a long time before I die.'

source_sentence: 大藥曰：『此解人言，王所親見。』
translation: Mahāprajñāpāramitā said, 'This is an explanation of the king's relatives' words.'

source_sentence: 王便大喜嗟異諸人。
translation: The king then rejoiced greatly and admired the people.

source_sentence: 「後於異時王試諸臣，誰有智慧？
translation: At another time, the king tested his ministers to see who had wisdom.

source_sentence: 便以諸羊人與一口，報言：『養令肥盛，不得使其肉有脂膏。』
translation: He then gave the sheep a mouthful of food and replied,'nurturing them so they'll grow fat that they won't allow their flesh to have fat and grease.'

source_sentence: 諸人無智皆養令肥。
translation: People lack the wisdom to nourish and make them fat.

source_sentence: 大藥得羊常與飲食，令其飽足形貌肥壯，然刻木為犲時來恐怖，羊雖飽食脂膏不生。
translation: The great herb obtains the goat and always feeds it, making it full and fed so that its shape becomes fat and strong. But when carved wood is used as dung, it's fearful, and even though the goat is full, fat and grease won't arise even if it eats it.

source_sentence: 殺已共觀果如其事。
translation: After killing them, they'll observe the results together as they are.

source_sentence: 王曰：『何意餘羊有膏卿羊無耶？』
translation: The king said, 'What do you think the other sheep have and don't have the goat of the lord?'

source_sentence: 以事具答。
translation: He answered with a detailed explanation of the matter.

source_sentence: 王曰：『深有奇智。』
translation: The king said, 'There's profound marvelous wisdom.'

source_sentence: 「後於異時，諸大臣子數有五百，同集芳園共為歡會，言論之次各相問曰：『於誰室中有奇異事？
translation: At another time, some five hundred ministers gathered together in the fragrant grove for a joyous assembly and asked each other, 'In whose room is there something strange?'

source_sentence: 或餘處見？
translation: Or are they seen in other places?

source_sentence: 宜各說之。』
translation: It's appropriate for each to explain it.'

source_sentence: 是時諸人悉皆說已，次問大藥之子：『汝之宅中有何奇異？』
translation: After they had all explained it, the people asked Mahāprajāpaṇḍa, 'What's so strange about your house?'

source_sentence: 答曰：『我家有石以呪力持，置在水中浮而不沒。』
translation: He answered, 'There's a stone in my house that's held by the power of a spell and placed floating in water without sinking.'

source_sentence: 諸人報曰：『未曾聞見石浮水上。』
translation: The people replied, 'I've never heard of a stone floating on water.'

source_sentence: 即共立契賭五百金錢，子還報父：『我言：「浮石，賭五百金錢。」』
translation: They then agreed to gamble five hundred pieces of money together, and the son returned to his father and told him, 'I said, floating stone, I'll wager five hundred pieces of money.'

source_sentence: 父曰：『不應現石，將錢五百酬彼諸人。』
translation: The father said, 'Shouldn't you show the stone and give five hundred pieces of money to those people?'

source_sentence: 大藥家中教一獼猴善閑音樂，告其子曰：『汝因集會可問諸人：「誰復見有奇異之事？」
translation: At the house of Mahāprajñāpāramitā, he taught a monkey to be good at music and told his son, 'You've gathered an assembly so you can ask people, Who else has seen this strange thing?'

source_sentence: 他皆說已汝當報曰：「我有獼猴善閑音樂，歌舞絲筑無不備解。」』
translation: After you've told them all, you should report, 'I have a rhesus monkey that's good at music and singing and dancing, and there's nothing he doesn't understand.'

source_sentence: 諸人報曰：『前無浮石，已罰五百金錢。
translation: The people replied, 'There's no floating stone in front of me, and I've already fined five hundred coins.

source_sentence: 今若更虛倍輸千直；
translation: Now, if he were to offer even more falsehood and double the true by a thousandfold.

source_sentence: 如其是實我出千錢。』
translation: If this is true, I'll give a thousand coins.'

source_sentence: 便將獼猴共至王所，令作音樂，是事皆成，彼出千錢以酬賭直。
translation: He then took the monkey with him to the king's place and asked him to make music, which was all done, and he offered a thousand coins to settle the bet.

source_sentence: 王曰：『我曾不見如是之事。』
translation: The king said, 'I've never seen such a thing before.'

source_sentence: 生大慶悅廣賜珍財，歎曰：『大藥之智於諸眾中最為第一。』
translation: He gave a great joyous gift of treasure and praised it, saying, 'The knowledge of the great medicine is the best among all people.'

source_sentence: 「時此城中有婆羅門，聰明叡智學善四明，娶妻未久便生一女，顏貌端正，
translation: At that time there was a brahman in this city, intelligent and wise, well versed in the four kinds of knowledge. Soon after he married his wife, she gave birth to a daughter with an elegant appearance.

source_sentence: 名為烏曇。
translation: He's called Udayana.

source_sentence: 婆羅門自立要曰：『若有男子於我邊學，與我齊肩者，我此妙女當嫁與之。』
translation: The Brāhmaṇa himself established the essentials, saying, 'If a man trains at my side and joins me with his shoulders, this marvelous woman will be married to him.'

source_sentence: 女漸長大，於此國中有婆羅門生一男子，形容可惡具十八種醜陋之相，
translation: As the daughter grew up, a brahman gave birth to a boy in her native land. The prince’s appearance was ugly and he displayed eighteen ugly features.

source_sentence: 父母見已極生不樂，名曰惡相，雖漸童年不教為學，此兒醜惡令我羞恥。
translation: When my parents saw this, they became extremely unhappy and called it a bad sign. Although I gradually grew up as a child, they did not teach me to study [the Buddhist teachings]. This ugly boy shamed me.

source_sentence: 其兒長大自恨無識，遂入城中以求學問。
translation: When the boy grew up, he resented his own consciousnesslessness and went into the city to study.

source_sentence: 至彼聰叡婆羅門所，禮而致白：『我來請益，幸見哀憐。』
translation: He went to that wise Brāhmaṇa, bowed his head in respect, and said, 'I've come to ask for help, so please have mercy on me.'

source_sentence: 彼便納受，未久之間所有書論悉皆學盡。
translation: They then accepted it, and in a short time all the books and treatises he had studied were collected.

source_sentence: 婆羅門便生是念：『我先立要，如其有人學盡我業者，我當以女妻之。
translation: The brāhmaṇa thought to himself, “First, let me lay down the essential principles. If a man were to terminate his studies in my occupation, I would marry that woman as my wife.

source_sentence: 此兒雖復容儀醜惡，難違本契；
translation: Although the boy’s manner was ugly and disrespectful, it was difficult for him to disobey his parents.

source_sentence: 若負心者不得生天。
translation: If someone's mind is negative, they can't be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 設令諸人見笑於我，我無違要。』
translation: If you cause people to see and laugh at me, I won't disobey them.'

source_sentence: 即為具禮以女娉之。
translation: He then paid homage to her and gave her a woman to him.

source_sentence: 其女威光儼然可畏，遂令惡相不敢近前。
